action.action-desc: Mr. Edwards (for himself and Mr. Murphy) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 23, United States Code, to establish a national requirement against the use of marijuana for recreational purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Pot Act of 2023.

section.header: National requirement against use of marijuana for recreational purposes

subsection.text: Chapter 1 of title 23, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: National requirement against use of marijuana for recreational purposes

subsection.text: The Secretary shall withhold 10 percent of the amount required to be apportioned to any State under each of sections 104(b)(1), 104(b)(3), and 104(b)(4) on the first day of each fiscal year beginning after the date of the enactment of this section in which the purchase or public possession of marijuana for recreational purposes is lawful.
No funds withheld under this section from apportionment to any State after the date of the enactment of this section shall be available for apportionment to such State.
In this section, the term marijuana shall have the meaning given such term in section 102 of the Controlled Substances Act (21 U.S.C. 802).
The analysis for chapter 1 of title 23, United States Code, is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 179 the following:

toc.toc-entry: 180. National requirement against use of marijuana for recreational purposes.
